instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power on
threads.message:
Hi, I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no power.
It has greenlight, fan spin, consumes around 300 mA on bench PSU, CPU gets hot, all big coils have voltage, but it does not have usb activity.

It had some corrosion on the <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> and so i replaced, and <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR> was blouwn and i replaced it too but still no power.
Now I get 1.05V on pin 2 of <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>, but when i measure <SIGNAL>P1V05S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR> it shuts down.

Can you help?

threads.message:
It worked with a new BIOS.
TKS!
